block.p: Even though he is running neck-in-neck with President Alberto K. Fujimori in the polls, Alejandro Toledo dropped out of the runoff in Peru's presidential race, saying he could not win on a playing field fraudulently tilted against him. Mr. Fujimori apparently has a clear shot at winning a third five-year term unless Mr. Toledo and the international community put enough pressure on the government to postpone the May 28 runoff election until mid-June.

Even though he is running neck-in-neck with President Alberto K. Fujimori in the polls, Alejandro Toledo dropped out of the runoff in Peru's presidential race, saying he could not win on a playing field fraudulently tilted against him. Mr. Fujimori apparently has a clear shot at winning a third five-year term unless Mr. Toledo and the international community put enough pressure on the government to postpone the May 28 runoff election until mid-June.
